resources.string: Chinese is spreading globally and Mandarin speakers are increasing worldwide. Learning Mandarin Chinese has brought attention to the people around the world.
The Chinese language is a logographic language system, unlike English, which uses an alphabetic system.
There are two written forms in the Mandarin Chinese language: Chinese characters and Hanyu Pinyin.
There are two types of Chinese character writing systems in the Chinese language, namely Traditional Chinese and Simplified Chinese.
Strokes are the basic components in Chinese Characters writing. Chinese radicals and characters are formed with different combinations of strokes ranging from one to more strokes.
The combination of different characters will become a new word and give a different meaning. Many Mandarin characters are generally written in either component or compound characters.
For example, 女(woman) and 子(child) are component characters that are used to form other compound characters, 好(good).
Each Chinese character has a transcribe of English alphabets known as Hanyu Pinyin or Pinyin. For example, 马 (character) has a Pinyin form of “mǎ”.

Besides, each syllable and character have four different tones that carry one or more meaning. For example, 妈 (mother), 麻(hemp), 马(horse), 骂(to scold) are all pronounced with Pinyin “ma” but with different tones
